text:
I had to send my Wii in for repair last year. While it was away, I thought it would be a good time to play Mario Sunshine, since I never finished it back in 2002. I forgot all about this song. It was such a lovely surprise to re-discover it on the Noki Bay level.
It will never be as good as Mario 64 but Sunshine is still a great game

author: ATfilms61

text: @Zachary1869 Ha. I'm 18, don't live around any of my friends at the moment.
author: ・ω・

text: @Zachary1869 Honestly I don't remember which is which, it's been quite some time since I've played. This discussion convinced me to get another copy, but the one I got from Gamestop didn't work. =.= Not sure where I put the receipt either. Blah.
author: ・ω・

text: @Zachary1869 Oh, true. Well, I think I played too much Mario Party, so the only challenge on the thumb was getting the stick to work properly.
author: ・ω・

text: @Zachary1869 Yeah, I'm not saying it was flawless. That's a good point. Also, the Sunshine boss was obviously silly, but I liked it anyway. The final fight always seems to be a cakewalk. That's just a Mario trademark, I guess. xD
author: ・ω・

text: @Zachary1869 No no, I am capable of keeping a level head in a harmless conversation. I just felt the opposite way; Galaxy left me wanting more because the levels were large and seemed so open with their space them, but there was little to actually do. And goodness, if by some possible chance you got lost, they conveniently placed Toad there to tell you which way was forward. >w>
author: ・ω・

text: @Zachary1869 Linearity was the basis of Mario in the beginning, yes, but it seems so much more limited when applied to the third dimension.
author: ・ω・

text:
It's amusing to see people call this game gimmicky but praise the Wii.

This is a superb game. It fine-tuned the physics of Mario 64, presented an original, entertaining and well-executed idea, featured amazing level design (and music, of course) and had a great world to explore, and that is far more than you can say about Galaxy, which was linearity to the extreme.
author: ・ω・

text: @Zachary1869 You act as though the blue coins were required in any way.
author: ・ω・

text: @charger619c Actually I believe it says in some encyclopedias that Super Mario Sunshine is a masterpiece and both Super Mario Galaxies are criminally overrated.
